paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted a novel frameshift mutation in the KCNH2 gene associated with long QT syndrome type 2, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.phenotype: Malignant ventricular arrhythmia, prolonged QT interval

individual_records.phenotype_details: Malignant ventricular arrhythmia, prolonged QT interval of 521 ms
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Genetic studies confirmed heterozygosity for a novel frameshift mutation for the KCNH2 gene, D896Rfs X79.

functional_data.summary: The mutation is expected to result in either an abnormal, truncated protein product or loss of protein from this allele through nonsense-mediated RNA decay.

variants.segregation_data: The patient's only daughter declined screening, and family screening could not be performed.
variants.population_frequency: The mutation is not reported in major variant databases.
variants.evidence_level: Class 1 mutation, expected to be pathogenic.
variants.additional_notes: The patient had a previously normal QTc of 426 ms and a benign cardiac history.
key_quotes: This mutation causes a shift in the reading frame starting at codon Aspartic acid 896 and changing it to an Arginine.
As a class 1 mutation, it is expected to result in either an abnormal, truncated protein product or loss of protein from this allele through nonsense-mediated RNA decay.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
